author: Rik
title: ADA news in African languages
description: News about Cardano should be available in native languages in African communities. However, The crypto world is English-speaking oriented

assessments.note: It seems obvious to grow the community in Africa information needs to be provided in African languages.

Reaching out to people in their native languages is a solid cause in the long term. Doing this by informing them about what the cardano blockchain has to offer will certainly create an opportunity for community influx with new insights and new ideas on Project Catalyst.

The proposal addresses the Fund 5 Africa challenge well. It addresses How Cardano can reach more people in Africa by breaking down the language barrier by creating content resources in native African languages. This project, if implemented well, will bring more users to the Cardano ecosystem.

The proposal is very interesting and summarized, because it intends to take various contents from the Catalyst community to various people in Africa, through the generation of translations in languages ​​spoken by the natives of the continent (with at least 1 million people who speak the language). In this way, an idea can benefit both Africa and our community, as it will reach potential new members, and in addition, these people may generate wealth for both themselves and the community. In other words, the project will bring potential returns in the future, not being limited to a single action.

In my opinion it is good to adress people in their own language. The proposed topics will be usefull. I agree that the cryptoworld is Englisch minded. This might help people who probely already heard about crypto and blockchain from fellow countymen and got interested to pick it up and form an opinion based on what the hear in their own language.

The project aims to increase native language content for non English speaking Africans by funding language ambassadors.  I think native language content may become more important if Cardano can connect the unconnected bringing online media to new communities.  For this reason, I think the proposal addresses the challenge well.
This proposal addresses the need for accessibility to the crypto world for africans in their native languages. this increases the reach and depth of trust when individuals first learn about crypto.

The proposal fits in with the outline challenge settings. Information regarding the languages to be used  as a trial should have been included to help readers and voters get a better understanding of the initial target markets. This ties in well into building the S.I.N Collective which can then be used to address future challenges
assessments.reply: We understand that the information about the langbassadors language used in the trial would be helpfull. But that will depend on the budget grant or not. After a test call out we noticed there are almost any imaginable language present in the Cardano community. We also noticed a lot are eager to help their community but cant invest even 150 usd for a tripod, some have no good camera, etc... Now we have already more than 19 languages covered and our group has already contacted personal networks that's why we keep growing steadily to 28 members in total now. But if we get funded, we get exposure to the whole cardano community and then it will be a question who to reject when our loan fund is used up completely. Off course we would look at the candidates with the languages spoken by most people to form the 12 selected Catalyst funded langbassadors. If we don't get sponsored we ll grow much slower and the overall effect of the prevention we will be able to perform will be lower. But overall the remarks he made were finetuning remarks, a 4 would be more appropriate evaluating that

assessments.note:
A project with a structure this big is bound to become a very broad and large task. 
It was unclear to me where these langbassadors would come from. What pool are you recruiting from and how are you planning to reach them? 
I'd like to add that the proposed project is massive and might be more feasible to achieve if executed in smaller steps. As the African continent holds a large number of different languages, consider focussing on a few major languages (e.g. French) to start with instead of going after all of them simultaneously. Then apply and expand that structure to other languages. That would ensure an early income and create a more robust system. 
In the attached documents, the proposer includes an incubator program. I am unsure how this fits in a news agency and it seems like this could serve as a second side project after the first one has successfully launched. 
Finally there is the requested budget which could be set much lower if the project starts out on a smaller scale to then scale up.
assessments.reply: The Langbassadors are still being recruted and we started on april 10 th after a try-call out on REDDIT/Cardano with over 75 responses leading to over 50 applicants. Not all have stayed because we weren't yet organised and ready, but a core group did and since then we grow steadily. The whole collective is now over 28 people strong, of which we have 19 languages covered. languages are ( not all included ) : spanish, portuguese, french, dutch, danish, swedish, norwegian,czech, hindi, urdu, arabic, ewe, swahili, tagalog, russian, german, ucrain, south-african, Tamazigh and Darija ( Arabic dialects spoken by >75 million people ). So we know a lot of potential African langbassadors host in our ever growing Cardano community, once we present our format the candidats will apply in greater numbers since the test try out was only seen by a fraction of the people. The problem most langbassadors out of developing countries have is they have no money to invest , just time, so that's why we ask for a loan fund so we ll be able to fund an army of eager langbassadors paying their loans back so the next batch can get started. So 24000 USD is to give us a fund with which we can let way more langbassadors start doing prevention and spreading the word about catalyst, not only in Africa but all throughout the world. The remaining 18000 USD is to let 12 people start informing & teaching the people in Africa about to be massively brought onto blockchain via atala prism for 3 months. The other projects within Safety in Numbers can all be considered as seperate projects which we off course will gradually implement, which  seems to be clear to every other CA except this one. We understand it takes a bit of time to read all documentation, but those who done that seem to grasp that clearly. The number of hours been put in project management alone well surpasses the 2000 hours already, and we ask 0 USD for all the work our mostly non-devs perform. I feel that just as it was with WADA there is a very large undervaluation of manhours performed by people doing groundwork & organisational work without producing a dapp and calling a budget of 42000 USD large for what we want to give in return is fundamentally unfair. If a developer puts in 2000 programming hours and asks for 42000 USD to make his product very successfull in the whole of africa no community advisor will call that expensive but dirt cheap . Mostly ; Our white paper describes the distribution of profits to the different earners collaborating on a broadcast: langbassador (presents the news broadcast), stake pool operator, content writer ( makes the news broadcast ), Content creator ( edits the broadcast ), :

assessments.note: It is likely for this proposal to be implemented because it includes a simple and straightforward strategy. This proposal is highly feasible. Plus, the proposer has experience speaking multiple languages, which is a plus to navigate and connect with various people from different parts of Africa and find ambassadors who will present the news in African native languages. The only question that I have is in which country or city will this project take place?

In relation to this, I think that the quality and use of the services of those involved will still be measured. The author, in turn, claims to have a long time of experience in the area of ​​economics, which is in total dialogue with the activities of the community. As mentioned in the text, the translators will spend 3 months working and from their performance they will have the contract renewed or not, so we can at least know that the quality of the work will be evaluated. Unlike other projects, there is no way to be sure of the team's competence at this point of the idea. One observation I can make is that it would be beneficial to also include someone focused on the administration of social networks, the media through which the generated content would be distributed. I may have missed this information in my analysis, but I didn't see it mentioned in the text.
I'm missing the experience on making broadcasts. It would be nice if this was mentioned or if there isn't enough experience a way how to assure that it will be managed.

The proposer is very enthusiastic and responsive, but I think the plan is a little too ambitious. One or two languages only  could be tried in a test run, and more funding requested in subsequent Catalyst rounds. This would result in a project easier to manage and more likely to produce high-quality, relevant content.
assessments.reply: there is clearly a lack of understanding of the overall plan of Safety in Numbers and the Langbassadors here. The langbassadors program consists of 1 news broadcast a week by a professional video editor, so afterwards its just adding narrated translations or a tape of the langbassador in front of a green screen into that same news broadcast. So the format produces the same quality whether we do it with 1 or 300 langbassadors. In the collective we all do what we are good at : the stake pool administrator creates & manages all stake pools, de (specialist ) content writer writes weekly the content, and a professional video editor makes the video's and adds in the tapes of each langbassador. The langbassadors themselves just translate and present in their native language. If you read the SIN-DOT comparison it should be clear that each module stands on itself and is easily scalable since we are with many and we all do what we are good at. We do agree that it is better to have brought out more concrete info about each team member and candidate langbassador but due to the serious timeloss of (mostly ) crypto and catalyst newbies and unavailability we have been working on our campaign website, but due to the fact that our kenyan webdeveloper suffered power outages for over a week we will only be able to bring out that info hopefully in the week to come. We regret that noone of the CA's concerned with that particular remark has asked for more explanation, we would have gladly provided it if it was asked.

assessments.note: The experience and KPM driven plan show that the vision is extremely clear. proper planning prevents piss poor performance. the 6 P's of project management.

I believe that this proposal provides enough evidence that proves that they are able to implement the proposal in a realistic timeframe. The budget was explained well however, explaining the method in the way funds would get collected if a langambassador defaults on their loan would make it easier to understand the "safety" or rather backup plan in the case of default of this method
This is relatively straight forward proposal. Its utility in expanding ADA in Africa is obvious.

The proposal's attached documents provided a lot of information about the project, both now and in the prospected future. However, it still left me with a few questions like how you would make sure that the staking pools would cover the cost and how many people S.I.N. currently holds.
assessments.reply: CA clearly thinks our concept is well thought out. The two small remarks are valid but the hardware for running a stakepool is not expensive and when 2 million ada is staked a stakepool earns revenue ( 340 ADA per epoch fixed can be viewed in every daedalus wallet ). The number of people involved with the project have grown from 3 on april 10 th to 28 as of today. But to mark that one piece of info lacking with a deduction of 2 is not consistent with remarks given

assessments.note: The information provided in the Roadmap is sufficient to trach and audit the project progress. The milestones' dates are provided, and KPI's is described in detail.

The proposal is very well planned: we have a list of subjects that are addressed in the translations, dates when the stages of the project will take place, details regarding the use of the money requested and an expectation in relation to the objectives to be achieved. Therefore, I believe that there are no gaps in relation to the information on the progress, planning and future execution of the project, everything being perfectly defined.

I like the idea and the first setup of topics. It might be usefull if there would haven been some information about the number of languages involved and the way to pick/choose the languages. As stated in reaction there are a lot languages.

The fund requests wages for the language Ambassadors and funds for a loan program to help them buy the necessary equipment. For better audibility I recommend the proposer go into more detail about the loan system and how it will function/be auditable.
assessments.reply: the CA seems convinced over the need of our project since he has no remarks about that,Also the way we plan to launch and help our langbassadors spread out quickly gets no negatives; he does give some great advice on finetuning our proposal even better. That seems like a score of 4 if the only remark is a point of improved auditability easily integratable

assessments.note: Scope, Timeline and Budget are well defined, KPM's are well defined, feedback channels are well defined, cant ask for much more.

A good timeline was provided and given KPI's are measured however I thought it would beneficial to include additional measures such as the watch time and the views to engagement ratio. This would allow you to evaluate whether the content being created is actually benefitting individuals in smaller communities. Possible challenges are not considered in enough detail making it hard to evaluate the progress of this proposal.
assessments.reply: We agree that the remarks of the CA if integrated would be a surplus. However, given the fact that this proposal is about prevention in a 'market' that as of yet has no millions of Africans on the blockchain, and the speed of adoption will clearly depend on the speed of signing and implementing the 100 million Africans via Atala Prism in the coming 2 years. How can we possible know which countries will be added when and where, we only know 100 million onboarded in Africa the coming 2 years  ? So how can we give predictions with any certitude since the market doesn't exist yet ? It should be clear that the Langbassadors perform Prevention, Information & Education : sponsoring 12 people to start making docutainment ( how to install a dadalus wallet and make sure you dont get scammend ) and creating weekly more content about Cardano & Catalyst will be visible on the channels ( and growing the sooner we can start a langbassador ). The moment all those onboarded new african Cardano users start searching for more info on youtube, the clickviews will rise up exponentially. But in this current situation NOONE can predict the exact when. But for us that is even besides the question. Prevention needs to be done before a main event ( and needs time to prepare ) , not afterwards when iohk gets bombared by hundreds of mails of africans having been tricked by a giveaway scam. It seems that those CA's getting how prevention works mark us 4-5. Those who don't see that ask for impossible predictions or call our budget asked too much grade us 3 or the odd 2

solution: Create a chain of YouTube channels bringing docutainment and a weekly edited news broadcast in native languages
